intro: Triadenum japonicum f. cuneatum, commonly known as Japanese triadenum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, triangular-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
